details.Allegations:
CLIENT PURCHASED DETROIT EDISON COMMON ON
SECONDARY OFFERING.  1 YEAR LATER CLIENT CLAIMED SHE THOUGHT
SHE PURCHASED A MUNICIPAL BOND.  AFTER DEPOSITIONS WERE TAKEN
SUTRO & I WITH ASSISTANCE OF STEVE YOUNG OF KESSAL YOUNG,
SETTLED THE CASE FOR $10,000.00 TO AVOID THE COST AND HASSEL OF
LITIGATION.I CONTRIBUTED $5,000 TOWARD THE SETTLEMENT.
details.Broker Comment:
NO ACTION BY REGULATORY BODIES, NO SUSPENSION OR
RESTRICTION.  SETTLEMENT OF $10,000, I CONTRIBUTED $5000.00.

alerts.description:
Customer dispute on 2/1/1983. Resolution: Settled. Allegations: CLIENT PURCHASED DETROIT EDISON COMMON ON
SECONDARY OFFERING.  1 YEAR LATER CLIENT CLAIMED SHE THOUGHT
SHE PURCHASED A MUNICIPAL BOND.  AFTER DEPOSITIONS WERE TAKEN
SUTRO & I WITH ASSISTANCE OF STEVE YOUNG OF KESSAL YOUNG,
SETTLED THE CASE FOR $10,000.00 TO AVOID THE COST AND HASSEL OF
LITIGATION.I CONTRIBUTED $5,000 TOWARD THE SETTLEMENT.. Damage requested: $250,000.00. Settlement: $10,000.00
